urls.title: WIRED Magazine Subscription

data.text: @ddt Yes, we paywall the letter because it's a subscriber benefit. But through this special link you can get not just Plaintext letter, but all of WIRED web content and print version (!) for a year. For only $5! Not bad. https://t.co/FtJwduLK8b

urls.title: Elon Musk's Twitter Is Making Meta Look Smart
urls.description: A scathing decision from Facebook’s Oversight Board shows a better way to work through platform rules in public than via a billionaire’s late night tweets.

data.text: Here's this week's letter. Due to an error, we dropped some lines in the email version and are resending. If you haven't read it yet, open the more recent the corrected one, or read it on the web through this link. If you HAVE read it take another look! https://t.co/kSWavgvL19
Doing another Plaintext after a week off for Covid--and looking for a good reader question. Ask me anything--including about Covid!

urls.title: Tony Fadell Is Trying to Build the iPod of Crypto

data.text: Tony Fadell is back! And for @ledger, he's trying to build the iPod of Crypto. https://t.co/todeWQ2A8t
@joshelman How about Sam Moore’s Law: “Hold On, It’s Coming”?
@paulg It’s not a stretch. It’s a fact. He has consciously taken action that says our participation is not welcome.
@paulg Exactly. Just because you can hack the system to read the tweets doesn’t mitigate that. He has explicitly excluded journalists—the people who inform the public—from the discussion.
@paulg That's not the point, is it?
@paulg The business person arguing for more speech blocks journalists so I can’t see the points he is making.
@rachelmetz @CNN Sorry to hear this. But looking forward to more of your work when some smart venue snaps you up.
@stevesilberman This is kind of spectacular.
@Jeff_McLane meant halfway "through" the end zone

@Jeff_McLane No clinch with ST. Halfway into end zone they run it out to midfield. It’s like they never practiced covering a kickoff.
@Jeff_McLane Teams are getting wise and not taking touchbacks against no-tackle #eagles. Now ST coach needed.

@DanFoxTO From the get-go, Twitter was easy to use. I think the problem might be that people are looking for a Twitter replacement and Mastodon is something different. Unfair to expect it to fill that role. But no matter what it wants to do, it needs better onboarding experience.
Onboarding on Mastodon is like signing up for college in a country where people disdain those who don't speak the local language, and you don't know a word of it.

urls.title: Executive Editor, News—WIRED
urls.description: Condé Nast is a global media company producing the highest quality content with a footprint of more than 1 billion consumers in 32 territories through print, digital, video and social platforms. The company’s portfolio includes many of the world’s most respected and influential media properties including Vogue, Vanity Fair, Glamour, Self, GQ, The New Yorker, Condé Nast Traveler/Traveller, Allure, AD, Bon Appétit and Wired, among others. Condé Nast Entertainment was launched in 2011 to develop film, television and premium digital video programming. At Condé Nast we value diversity of background, views and cultures. We celebrate people for their personal qualities, their skills and contributions. And we recognize the power our brands have to influence and shape culture, catalyze action and help make our world a better place for all. For more information, please visit condenast.com and follow @CondeNast and @CondeNastCareer for Twitter and @condenastcareers for Instagram. WIRED is where a

Playing 162 regular season games for the miniscule advantage of one extra home game in an essentially random five-game series and the possible detriment of having a week off before starting the postseason is patently ridiculous.
Parade magazine is down to 10 pages.

Day 2 #ucsfmhp2022. Brad @SharpeUCSF on pneumonia. Take-homes:
Yes, check for flu (and Rx if positive) during flu season.
No, don't send respiratory viral panel (costs $3K & won't change management)
No, don't use procalcitonin to decide on antibiotics (too many false neg results) https://t.co/XnThl4jl4b

urls.title: Meta Is Still Betting on a VR Revolution That May Never Come
urls.description: This week, we discuss Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg’s ambitions for growing virtual reality as a platform, and how the new Quest Pro headset fits into that vision.

tweets.text: Since I'm in NYC this week, I asked @stevenlevy, who wrote the book on Meta/Facebook, to join the @WIRED @gadgetlab pod. We talked about Meta Quest Pro, the innovator's dilemma, and whether Zuckerberg would ever pivot from his grand vision of the metaverse https://t.co/AGdgsj6m10
@page88 Take sleep aids…edibles come to mind.
